meanings.definition: To shine brighter or more intensely than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sun was outglaring all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile outglared the dim streetlights on the dark road.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight was outglaring the glow-in-the-dark toy, making it jealous.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse outglared the full moon, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign outglared all the other signs on the busy street, attracting customers with its brightness.

meanings.definition: To be more conspicuous or noticeable than something else.
meanings.sent1: The colorful bird outglared the plain ones in the flock.
meanings.sent2: His loud laughter outglared the quiet chatter in the room.
meanings.sent3: The bright red umbrella was outglaring all the black umbrellas, standing out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her unique talent outglared the other performers, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The new billboard outglared the old ones, stealing attention with its bold design.
